text:
We tried the sample test call for checking whitelisting and it worked:
```for url in $(curl -sSL <https://scan.sv-2.global.canton.network.digitalasset.com/api/scan/v0/scans> | jq -r '.scans | .[].scans | .[] | .publicUrl' ); do   echo -n "$url: ";   curl -sSL --connect-timeout 5 --fail-with-body $url/api/scan/version | jq -r '.version'; done```

text: If a validator that is hosting external parties gets compromised (e.g.: the validator private key are not available anymore), what would be the process to migrate those external parties to a new validator, what would happen to those external parties Canton Coin balance?

text:
<@U01QXFNQ5QB> If you'd present this question in terms of points that you feel are not well articulated in the docs, that would be really helpful:

<https://docs.sync.global/validator_operator/validator_disaster_recovery.html#disaster-recovery>

elements.text: If you'd present this question in terms of points that you feel are not well articulated in the docs, that would be really helpful:

text: Is it possible to assign the same (keycloak) user to different parties/wallets? If yes, how can I determine which one to use?

elements.text: Is it possible to assign the same (keycloak) user to different parties/wallets? If yes, how can I determine which one to use?

text:
Yes, a Canton User can be configured to `actAs` and `readAs` multiple parties. The Canton User is what gets matched against the `sub:` field of the token generated by your IDP (for example, KeyCloak).

As to “how to determine which one to use”, you may find <https://discuss.daml.com/t/access-token-readas-and-actas-ledger-link-with-sub/4604?u=wallacekelly|this Daml Forums post> helpful.

> there is never a case where this is ambiguous.
It is not ambiguous because the Daml model templates specify the `signatories` and the choices specify the `controllers`. To create a contract or exercise a choice, the node will calculate what is required and then check to see that your token has the required authorization.

attachments.fallback: Daml Developers Community: Access token: readAs and ActAs: ledger link with sub?
attachments.text: How/is the actAs and readAs rights associated in the ledgers actions against the sub in the token (the user id) within the specific commit/transaction? Additionally how does actAs get chosen if multiple values are provided and those values can all be used for a single submitter? (Such as a controller of a choice: actAs=owner, team-leader, and controller owner, teamLeader. Thanks!
attachments.title: Access token: readAs and ActAs: ledger link with sub?

text:
There are times when your application will need to decide what goes into the query, create, or exercise arguments. That is up to your applications.

Some applications rely on the `primaryParty` of the Canton User. <https://discuss.daml.com/t/example-when-canton-users-primaryparty-makes-a-difference/7947?u=wallacekelly|This Daml Forums post> discusses that.

attachments.fallback: Daml Developers Community: Example when Canton User's primaryParty makes a difference?

It is likely using the `primaryParty` field. The Splice wallet does that.

I know of another application in which the application has UI support for the user to switch between the parties in the `actAs` array.
